results.title: Jumpy, the grasshopper
results.brief_description: Jumpy tells a story about a grasshopper and other insects as a basis for language/arts activities, and to enrich the study of insects. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: Jumping the gun
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Murray Fahey and Jane Schneider
results.brief_description: Combining style from film noir, TV advertising imagery, Mills and Boon romance and Sydney ghetto realism, this is a farcical look at how one woman’s “morning after” fantasy turns into a tragi-comic nightmare.

results.title: Jumping for Joy
results.creator_credit: Thames and Clyde Film Company, Educational Films of Scotland and Stanley Russell
results.brief_description: An introduction to trampolining. A semi-instructional film, it shows the growing popularity of the five basic landing positions, and shows suitable exercises for people of different ages. A section on the value of trampolining in rehabilitation work is also included.

results.title: Jumpin' Jack Flash (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Lawrence Gordon, Joel Silver and Penny Marshall
results.brief_description: Whoopi Goldberg stars in this action adventure comedy hit. There’s music, murder, mayhem and a lot of laughs as she tries to save an endangered spy operative, code-named Jack - even though she’s never met him! Now the CIA and the KGB have her jumpin’ and the world may never be the same.

results.title: Jump the fence
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Natalie Green and Lucy MacLaren
results.brief_description: Two young girls who feel restricted at home decide to escape in a gelati van. After a short burst of freedom they end up in Winlaton, a girls’ training centre.

results.title: Jump rope
results.creator_credit: Pyramid Films, Computer Image and Robert Primes
results.brief_description: The camera zooms slowly in on a zoetrope featuring the stationary figure of a girl with a jump-rope. The zoetrope begins t turn and the jumping figure dissolves into life-enchanting, super-slow motion shots of young people jumping ropes. One unusual sequence views a jumper from below. Sequences employing multiple exposure and special computer techniques are used in demonstrating the healthful benefits of rope jumping.

results.title: Jump jet
results.creator_credit: British Broadcasting Corporation and Derek Smith
results.brief_description: The aeroplane was invented in the early 1900s. Since then there have been only three major breakthroughs in aviation: the jet, the helicopter, and the jump jet. Traces the development of the vertical take-off jet in Britain, with some reference to developments in other countries. Narrated by Richard Maddock.

results.title: Jump for glory
results.creator_credit: Criterion Film Productions, Marcel Hellman and Raoul Walsh
results.brief_description: In this romantic crime drama, a cat burglar gets emotionally involved with one of his victims. Unfortunately, the woman he woos is engaged to the thief’s treacherous ex-partner. The louse has reformed and to all appearances is an honest, successful businessman. But appearances are deceiving. The two men end up battling it out. Later the businessman is found dead. Unfortunately, during the trial, the blame is placed upon the girl. The thief tries to take the rap for her. In the end, however, it is revealed that the businessman actually killed himself after a stock market crash.

results.title: Jumanji [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Tri-Star Pictures, Scott Kroopf, William Teitler and Joe Johnston
results.brief_description: For 26 years Adrian Parrish has been trapped inside an ancient board game called Jumanji. The two children who release him also unwittingly unleash a group of wild jungle creatures who go on a rampage. Alan must save his hometown from destruction or risk being exiled back into the game. Cast includes Robin Williams as Adrian Parrish.
